author: axic3354
content:
For next week's EOF breakout room, it would be nice to discuss type section flags (especially non-returning functions). Here's some background and options: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/SJbHuChTj

Ideally we agree on one option and be done with it.

author: _shemnon
content: These seem to be focused on the compiler/transforming interpreter usecase, what is the utility of these flags in the typical "validator node" case?  Would they  impose validation impacts (i.e. no writinging in static, no reading in pure, no returns allowed for non-returning)?  If they impose validation requirements can these flags be derived from code analysis?

author: axic3354
content: If purity would become a flag, then yes, it would need to be enforced. Which practically means restricts what instructions are accepted within that code section.

author: axic3354
content: Not proposing to introduce that functionality now, just discussing whether it is something useful and be forward compatible with that.
